Sentencas: The major design parameters of SOFC have great impacts on the net electrical efficiency of SOFC/GT hybrid systems.
Titulo: Coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on system net efficiency in natural gas hybrid SOFC/GT system

Sentencas: The influence of the SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on the net efficiency of a pressurized solid oxide fuel cell gas turbine hybrid system was studied in this paper.
Titulo: Coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on system net efficiency in natural gas hybrid SOFC/GT system

Sentencas: The system model was combined a 1D SOFC model, which included a lumped equilibrium steam methane reformer model in the Simulink, with a gas turbine recuperated cycle model in Ebsilon (R).
Titulo: Coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on system net efficiency in natural gas hybrid SOFC/GT system

Sentencas: A system design point study was established to observe the coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on the system performance.
Titulo: Coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on system net efficiency in natural gas hybrid SOFC/GT system

Sentencas: Thirty design cases of SOFC operating temperatures (635 degrees C-835 degrees C) over a range of SOFC fuel utilization(45%-90%) were evaluated.
Titulo: Coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on system net efficiency in natural gas hybrid SOFC/GT system

Sentencas: The optimal SOFC fuel utilization shifted from 65% to 55% when the SOFC operating temperature decreased from 835 degrees C to 635 degrees C. The maximal(minimal) system efficiency was 74%(49%) at 65%(90%) SOFC fuel utilization with operating SOFC at 835 degrees C(635 degrees C).
Titulo: Coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on system net efficiency in natural gas hybrid SOFC/GT system

Sentencas: The results show that high operating temperature leads to the high efficiency of the entire hybrid system, but high fuel utilization might cause a decrease in system efficiency.
Titulo: Coupling impacts of SOFC operating temperature and fuel utilization on system net efficiency in natural gas hybrid SOFC/GT system
